serineDispatcher

Class VirtualDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • serineDispatcher.VirtualDevice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Postable

    public abstract class VirtualDevice
extends java.lang.Object
implements Postable
    This abstract class provides the foundations for virtual devices that are exchanging messages according to the Serine Protocol. The ID may be inputted either during the creation or by a posterior call. In accordance with this ID, messages are selected. Of course, a broadcast message is also a valid message to this device.

      • getId

      • setId

        public void setId(char newID)
        Changes the ID of the virtual device in the network.
        Parameters:
        newID - The new valid ID

      • processMessageToMe

        public abstract void processMessageToMe()
        This is a message processor to be implemented by the class. Please, note that both the messages sent to the ID of this virtual device as well as those ones sent as broadcast messages are valid messages. Broadcast messages should be processed by the method processBroadcastMessage. The message to be processed is available as a String and a array of Char.

      • processBroadcastMessage

        public abstract void processBroadcastMessage()
        This is a message processor to be implemented by the class. Please, note that both the messages sent to the ID of this virtual device as well as those ones sent as broadcast messages are valid messages. Specific messages should be processed by the method processMessageToMe. The message to be processed is available as a String and a array of Char.

      • postHere

        public boolean postHere(java.lang.String message)
        This method allows posting a valid Serine Protocol message to this virtual device.
        Specified by:
        postHere in interface Postable
        Parameters:
        message - A valid message string. For example: "drCxxx;"
        Returns:
        true if the message has been processed by this virtual device.
